mainmatter.p: An embedding \varphi : \mathcal {A} \rightarrow \mathcal {B} between \mathcal {L}-structures is a isomorphism if it is surjective.

frontmatter.title: Definition of an embedding of L-structures

mainmatter.p: Given two structures in a language \mathcal {L} \mathcal {A} and \mathcal {B}, an embedding \varphi : \mathcal {A} \rightarrow \mathcal {B} is a homomorphism such that:

For every n-ary relation R \in \mathcal {L}, for all a_1, \dots , a_n \in A, \varphi (R^{ \mathcal {A}}(a_1, \dots , a_n)) \text { holds } \Leftrightarrow R^{ \mathcal {B}}( \varphi (a_1), \dots , \varphi (a_n)) holds
This is stronger than a homomorphism because we now require a two way implication in the above property.
